Vaccination is our best tool against severe COVID-19, and more than 60% of everyone in the U.S. has been fully vaccinated, but there are still communities across the country and around the world who remain vulnerable.

Non-vaccine interventions like masks are still useful. https://t.co/26AiW0qNKZ

Let's be clear:

‚Ä¢ COVID-19 vaccines are effective at protecting people from COVID-19 and help keep adults and children from getting seriously sick.

‚Ä¢ COVID-19 vaccines can reduce the risk of people spreading the virus that causes COVID-19. https://t.co/MSPFy2snZL

There is emerging evidence that although the omicron variant can better evade neutralizing antibodies, vaccine-induced immunity still protects against severe COVID-19.
